amendment.description: Add at the end the following: \ SEC. __. SENSE OF CONGRESS. \ It is the sense of Congress that any and all precautions shall be taken by the government to avoid the unfair or unreasonable taking of property away from survivors of Hurricane Katrina who own, were bequeathed, or assigned such property, for economic development purposes or for the private use of others.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 10 printed in House Report 109-266 to express the sense of Congress regarding the legislative intent to protect from the taking by the Federal government for economic development or for private use of the property owned, either by assignment, intestate succession, or by record, by survivors of Hurricane Katrina.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Jackson-Lee (TX) amendment (A009) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A009) offered by Ms. Jackson-Lee (TX).
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Jackson-Lee (TX) amendment (A009) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
